title: Refactoring and improving standalone mode
body:
- Put the standalone mode cli into a separate heron-admin cli
- allow users to submit topologies to standalone cluster via apiserver
- Users can submit a topology via a service-url or without.  If you do not provide a service url the configs in ~/.heron/conf/standalone needs to correspond to the cluster.  These configs will be set for you if you start a standalone cluster.
- Being able to user a service-url allows users to easy share access with other users since all you need to submit a topology to the cluster is the service-url

To set cluster roles:

`heron-admin standalone set`

To start cluster:

`heron-admin standalone cluster start`

To get service-url:

`heron-admin standalone get service-url`

To submit topology with service-url:

`heron submit --service-url=http://10.128.0.5:9000 standalone  ~/heron/bazel-bin/examples/src/java/api-examples-unshaded_deploy.jar com.twitter.heron.examples.api.AckingTopology --verbose test3`

To submit topology without service-url:

`heron submit standalone  ~/heron/bazel-bin/examples/src/java/api-examples-unshaded_deploy.jar com.twitter.heron.examples.api.AckingTopology --verbose test5`

To kill:

`heron kill --service-url=http://10.128.0.5:9000 standalone test2`

or 

`heron kill standalone test2`

Stop Cluster:

`heron-admin standalone cluster stop`

title: Refactor aurora scheduler to use SchedulerUtils to construct arguments
body:
Refactor aurora scheduler code to be more consistent with other schedulers.

Topology arguments are hardcoded in aurora config file currently instead of using the shared functions in SchedulerUtils. It is hard to maintain and it is causing compatibility issue (since config file is in client and the setup code is in core).

fyi @jerrypeng

title: Fix unit tests (MetricsCacheSinkTest, TMasterSinkTest)
body:
Found a unit test issue with this PR:

https://github.com/twitter/heron/pull/1887

LatchedMultiCountMetric is used to verify the counting. However, because the config triggers Unresolved exception when creating client, the counting is called afterwards in the sink code hence it shouldn't be called. Reverting the change to check the new location has been picked up.

Also the code and the comment don't agree with each other in the basic tests (testTMasterClientService and testMetricsCacheClientService). Updated code to be consistent with the comment. It is also more reliable with this change.

title: Multi node standalone cluster for heron
body:
I have added scripts and features to allow users to easily stand up a mutli node Heron cluster.

Users can start a cluster using the heron CLI as follows

```
# Set Roles
$ heron standalone set masters
$ heron standalone set slaves
$ heron standalone set zookeepers # users will need to start their own zookeeper cluster
# Start cluster
$ heron standalone cluster start
# Submit topology
$ heron submit standalone  ~/workspace/heron/bazel-bin/examples/src/java/api-examples-unshaded_deploy.jar com.twitter.heron.examples.api.AckingTopology test1
# Kill topology
$ heron kill standalone test1
# Stop Cluster
$ heron standalone cluster stop
```

Add an Http uploader for uploading topology packages.
Add endpoints to API Server so that topology packages can be uploaded to it and dowloaded by executors 

@kramasamy contributed to this PR by implementing the packaging of the Nomad in the heron install script

title: keep topology defn during update
body:
We found that the topology defn is changed during update process, which causes the messy state. The original topology definition should remain same during the whole topology lifecycle, while the packing plan shows the latest topology information during update/repack.

This PR keeps topology defn during update.

Tested in local scheduler with #2600.

title: RoundRobinPacking implements IRepacking
body:
Walk around https://github.com/twitter/heron/issues/2576
Some legacy topologies use RoundRobinPacking lacking configurations for neither ResourceCompliantRRPacking nor FirstFitDecreasingPacking, which results in exceptions.
This PR enables IRepacking implementation for RoundRobinPacking.

Tested with local scheduler
`~/bin/heron update --verbose --dry-run --config-property heron.class.repacking.algorithm=com.twitter.heron.packing.roundrobin.RoundRobinPacking local WordCountTopology --component-parallelism consumer:4`

	at org.apache.storm.utils.ConfigUtils.translateComponentConfig(ConfigUtils.java:62)
	at org.apache.storm.topology.IRichBoltDelegate.getComponentConfiguration(IRichBoltDelegate.java:78)

title: improve FileSystemStateManager doMain print
body:
$ java -jar lib/statemgr/heron-zookeeper-statemgr.jar WordCountTopologyNew szookeeper.xxxx.com

Exception in thread "main" java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.RuntimeException: Failed to fetch data from path: /xxxxx/pplans/WordCountTopologyNew
at com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractFuture$Sync.getValue(AbstractFuture.java:299)
at com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractFuture$Sync.get(AbstractFuture.java:286)
at com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractFuture.get(AbstractFuture.java:116)
at com.twitter.heron.statemgr.FileSystemStateManager.doMain(FileSystemStateManager.java:299)
at com.twitter.heron.statemgr.zookeeper.curator.CuratorStateManager.main(CuratorStateManager.java:443)
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Failed to fetch data from path: /storm/heron/states/pplans/WordCountTopologyNew
at com.twitter.heron.statemgr.zookeeper.curator.CuratorStateManager$1.processResult(CuratorStateManager.java:309)
at org.apache.curator.framework.imps.CuratorFrameworkImpl.sendToBackgroundCallback(CuratorFrameworkImpl.java:743)
at org.apache.curator.framework.imps.CuratorFrameworkImpl.processBackgroundOperation(CuratorFrameworkImpl.java:520)
at org.apache.curator.framework.imps.GetDataBuilderImpl$3.processResult(GetDataBuilderImpl.java:254)
at org.apache.zookeeper.ClientCnxn$EventThread.processEvent(ClientCnxn.java:564)
at org.apache.zookeeper.ClientCnxn$EventThread.run(ClientCnxn.java:498)

The command stopped printing the next nodes in zk when some node failed. it is better to bypass the exception and continue printing the next nodes.

This PR improve the above issue.

title: Fix for "Marathon scheduler generates json based on "old method""
body:
See issue: https://github.com/twitter/heron/issues/2581

This works around the current errors on marathon.


I figured it might be optimal to allow for a self-declared "headgroup"/"topology"/"0...1" but did not implement this for the current pull request as that change would be more intrusive.

This is merely a bugfix for upcoming versions of marathon that will enforce absolute pathing in the POST message as per example: https://github.com/mesosphere/marathon/commit/261880df99113f0e1b3e03791e0850b1da2457d1

title: fix mismatch container id between packing alg and aurora
body:
1, Currently, Heron has the issues ....
We found the mismatch container id between packing algorithm and aurora during `heron update`

2, This pull request does ....
The PR updates the packing plan container id with aurora container id after 'aurora allocates container' and before 'update packing plan in zk'.
This PR changes spi/IScalable interface addContainers().

3, With this fix, Heron can ....
IScalable. addContainers() returns the new container id. Heron can re-map the real container id from Aurora to packing plan.

4, Test has been done .....
test done in Aurora datacenter.
testcase: in-consecutive container id test case.
testcase: append container, append after in-consecutive id container
testcase: remove container at the end and in the middle of id range

title: fix a bug for `deactivated heron-instance` during `heron update`
body:
We saw below events by time sequence during `heron update` scaling up:
1. the old bolt is deactivated, its in-stream-queue drains and is empty
2. the new added bolt is deactivated, its in-stream-queue is full due to instance did not start().
3. the new added bolt does not receive pplan from stmgr due to in-stream-queue full.
4. Then this bolt never receives the `activate` tuple

This PR fix the above bug by:
1. let instance start()

title: Fix the logging of System Config
body:
Currently, when heron-instance tries to log the System Config, it will only log the reference value,
since there is no correct override for SystemConfig.toString().

This pull request fixes this issue by overriding the SystemConfig.toString().

Tested with LocalScheduler.

title: Log component's config when constructing the heron-instance
body:
Currently, people are having a hard time to figure out the actual configs applying to a component:
- There are a lot of transformations and overrides
- The actual configs applied are not directly visible

This pull request logs the actual configs applying to the instance during the actual config construction for an instance.
It makes debug easier.
Furthermore, it is invoked only when having new PhysicalPlanHelper, so it does not hurt runtime performance.

repo.name: incubator-heron
repo.description: Apache Heron (Incubating) is a realtime, distributed, fault-tolerant stream processing engine from Twitter

title: Standardize builder interfaces and remove Resources class
body:
We currently have two builder patterns active:

```java
// Pattern 1
T t = new T.Builder()
    .build();

// Pattern 2
T t = T.newBuilder()
    .build();
```

This PR standardizes on pattern 2 for the `Config` and `Resources` classes in the Streamlet API. If there are remaining usages of pattern 1, please let me know.

This PR also removes the `Resources` class from the Streamlet API. In the future it may prove to be worthwhile to have a separate config class for that (if resource configuration becomes far more complex) but for now I think that this greatly simplifies the API. Now you can create a topology config like this:

```java
Config topologyConfig = Config.newBuilder()
    .setContainerRamInGB(10)
    .setContainerCpu(10.0f)
    .setDeliverySemantics(DeliverySemantics.ATMOST_ONCE)
    .build();
```

title: Retry when failing to kill an Aurora topology
body:
A lot of Twitter internal topology owners complained heron failing to kill an aurora topology because
the Aurora service can be unavailable or unstable for a while, or it can sometimes provide a false negative response.

This pull request adds retry mechanism to kill an Aurora topology with more confidence. It can increase the robustness of AuroraScheduler regardless of the Aurora Service People can also specify the retry attempts and interval via config.

This pull request also re-format some coding-styles for `RuntimeManagerRunner.java`.

repo.name: incubator-heron
repo.description: Apache Heron (Incubating) is a realtime, distributed, fault-tolerant stream processing engine from Twitter

title: remove yaml cpp binary and use bazel native rules
body:
Purpose of this pull request
Make the compilation faster for yaml cpp

How would this pull request resolve the issue
This pull request untars the binary tar ball into actual files and directly uses bazel to compile. Hence yaml cpp does not depend on make/automake/cmake/autoconfig etc. Since bazel uses parallelism underneath, it speeds up compilation.

What would be when the pull request is merged: (Issues resolved? What's the expected results?)
The expected result is in the increase faster compilation. This is a part of the broader effort to remove tar balls out of the code base. If Twitter were to mirror selective github repos, we can further simplify the PR using new_git_repository rules. It can be done in a later PR once repos are setup.

repo.description: Apache Heron (Incubating) is a realtime, distributed, fault-tolerant stream processing engine from Twitter

title: Use builder pattern in Streamlet API
body:
At the moment, there are two classes in the Streamlet API (`Config` and `Resources`) that could benefit from a more user-friendly builder pattern (I've also added constructors that explicitly use the defaults). I've updated these classes to use this pattern as well as existing Streamlet API examples. Here's an example:

```java
Resources resources = Resources.defaultResources();

Config config = new Config.Builder()
        .setNumContainers(3)
        .setContainerResources(resources)
        .build();
```

title: Change heron api dependency
body: This change separates the core low level ui(the ui that the instance targets) and the high level streamlet interface. The aim of this is to ensure that dependent librarires(like heron-storm) only deal with the core api and the higher level streamlet api can morph pretty rapidly without worrying compatibility issues.
